results.title: GoldenEye 007
results.brief_description: GoldenEye 007 inspired endless fun when it was released on the Nintendo 64 – just as long as you didn’t look at anyone’s screen or play as Odd Job. One of the first multi-player first-person-shooters for console, GoldenEye made everyone 007.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

constellations_other.name: Capturing first-person POV
constellations_other.description: A comparison of how videogames and feature films have used first person POV shots and sequences and how (for the latter) camera technology has impacted on this.

recommendations.quote: There's never been a better adaptation of film into a videogame than Golden Eye. For the first time, up to four players could shoot it out on one TV screen and take control of one of some of cinema's best heroes and villains. And yes, Odd Job is cheating.

results.description: GoldenEye 007 inspired endless fun when it was released on the Nintendo 64 – just as long as you didn’t look at anyone’s screen or play as Odd Job. One of the first multi-player first-person-shooters for console, GoldenEye made everyone 007.

results.title: Golden sands
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes beach mining for minerals - rutile, zircon, ilmenite and monazite - as an important Australian industry. Shows several methods of extracting these minerals and explains many of their uses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Golden river
results.creator_credit: P.V. Pathy and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Rising in the ranges of Coorg, the Kaveri River flows eastwards for nearly 500 miles before entering the Bay of Bengal, traversing ancient agricultural lands, rich in rice and coffee. Traces the course of the Kaveri River which has been considered sacred by the Hindus for centuries. The waters of the river have been utilised for the generation of electic power at Sivasamudram and harnessed in Mysore and Mettur for the two great dams which irrigate thousands of acres of land.

results.title: Golden queen
results.creator_credit: Zain Hussain and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: The pineapple industry in Malaya; harvesting, canning and selling the crop; the organisation of the industry; clearing land for new plantations, planting and caring for the plants; life on the plantation village.

results.title: Golden oldies
results.creator_credit: Arthur Everard, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: There are 80-year-olds who still jog, play golf, paint the roof of their house, work their farms and generally enjoy the hustle and bustle of everyday life. A positive look at ‘old age’ in the golden time of life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Everard, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Golden Gate
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is America”.
San Francisco is the subject of this United States Travel Service program, from the series, “This Is America”. It is a colourful and breezy look at the Californian city which attracts so many tourists annually. Highlights include Fisherman’s Wharf, the Golden Gate Bridge, Chinatown and Alcatraz

results.title: Golden braid
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Paul Ammitzboll, Santhana Naidu, Film Victoria and Illumination Films (AU)
results.brief_description: Bernard is an eccentric clockmaker; Terese is the sultry young Salvation Army worker with whom he is having an affair. Obsessed by the past, he finds a golden braid in an 18th century cabinet and immerses himself in the pursuit of a fantasy. It is up to Terese to lure him away from the ghost of the past, reignite their passion and seduce him back to reality.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cox, Paul Ammitzboll, Santhana Naidu, Film Victoria and Illumination Films (AU)

results.title: Golden beginnings
results.brief_description: Traces the development of Ballarat from the first gold strike in 1851 and the mining period that followed, through its early industrial growth to its present position as a prosperous industrial city. Narrated by John Collins. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
